news.title: SC allows M3M Group's plea for substitution of provisionally attached property
news.para: A bench of Justices P S Narasimha and R Mahadevan, however, said the substitution of the property would be subject to nine conditions as suggested by ED.

news.title: Lodha Developers to deposit ₹520 crore as security in legal case against V Hotels
news.para: Lodha Developers Ltd informed that this matter is related to proceedings initiated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the erstwhile promoter of V Hotels Ltd (VHL). This was in relation to a transaction of Rs 520.80 crore, allegedly routed through VHL before the start of the insolvency process.

news.title: New World Development shares jump after closing $11.2 billion refinancing deal
news.para: New World's shares soared around 8% in morning trade, compared to the broader market's 0.7% rise. They resumed trading after a holiday in Hong Kong on Tuesday and provided the first stock market reaction since the successful refinancing was announced late on Monday.

news.title: Sudhanshu Infrastructure booked for illegal construction, assault in Bhandup redevelopment case
news.para: The Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) has filed a police complaint against Sudhanshu Infrastructure and Abhayjit Dubey for unauthorized construction and occupancy violations at Aniraj Tower in Bhandup. The developer allegedly constructed an illegal hall, handed over commercial units without approvals, and defied repeated notices. Following complaints, Dubey and an associate also face charges for assaulting a society member.

news.title: Keystone Realtors to redevelop eight societies in Andheri West, Mumbai
news.para: Boman Irani, chairman and managing director of Keystone Realtors said, "With a GDV of nearly ₹3,000 crore and a significant development footprint, this project exemplifies our focus on scale, location, and value creation."

news.title: Asian Paints shares decline nearly 2% in morning trade
news.para: The direction follows a complaint filed by Grasim Industries (Birla Paints Division), which accused Asian Paints of engaging in exclusionary practices aimed at stifling its entry and growth in the Indian decorative paints segment.

news.title: Norges Bank sells ₹42 crore stake in Raymond Realty; parent too sees deal frenzy worth ₹221 crore
news.para: Norges Bank, representing the Norwegian Government Pension Fund Global, offloaded shares at Rs 1,005.94 apiece. Raymond Realty stock closed at Rs 999, down nearly 4% or Rs 40 from the IPO discovery price of Rs 1,039.30.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh notifies capital region land pooling scheme rules, 2025
news.para: S Suresh Kumar, principal secretary to the government, Municipal Administration and Urban Development, said these rules shall apply to the 'capital region' except the 'capital city area' which will continue to be governed by the Andhra Pradesh Capital City Land Pooling Scheme (Formulation and Implementation) Rules, 2015.

news.title: Landlords to auction assets of Bhadravati civic body
news.para: The land, measuring 30,033 square feet and owned by Raju Gundawar, Sanjay Gundawar, and Kishor Gundawar, was leased to the municipal council in 2018 at a monthly rent of 66,000.

news.title: Pimpri Chinchwad civic body's property tax collection in Q1 FY26 stands at ₹522 crore
news.para: In the first 90 days, the PCMC has collected Rs522 crore towards property tax, which is over 50% of the total tax revenue earned in the last fiscal year. Last year, the civic body reached the Rs500-crore-mark only by Oct.

news.title: Ranchi civic body collects record ₹39 crore property tax in Q1 FY26
news.para: The civic body attributed the rise in collections to multiple factors — a tiered rebate system, increased digital adoption, expanded door-to-door collection, and payment facilitation centres.

news.title: Nagpur civic body collects ₹89 crore property tax in Q1 FY26
news.para: Of the total, 96,993 property owners used online platforms like the NMC website, the My Nagpur mobile app, and the WhatsApp chatbot, paying a total of Rs 49.92 crore.

news.title: Now, auto mutation of property in Chandigarh to be in less than a week
news.para: The system enables automatic processing of mutation based on registered property deeds, eliminating the need for a separate mutation application by the transferee and reducing manual intervention.

news.title: Trichy civic body faces ₹121 crore deficit as commercial spaces remain vacant
news.para: At least 58 shops across three Corporation-owned complexes have been unoccupied for the past three years. These spaces could generate over 2 crore in annual rental income if fully utilized.

news.title: Government to enforce real estate regulations, strengthen Odisha RERA compliance
news.para: The decision was taken at a high-level meeting chaired by chief secretary Manoj Ahuja recently. As per the decision, authorities have been asked to invoke the Odisha Public Demand Recovery (OPDR) Act to recover penalties from defaulters, ensuring compliance with ORERA's directives.

news.title: Notices to 266 for business operations at homes, building code violations in Gurugram
news.para: Of these, 183 were in phase 3 and 83 in Phase 2. In total, over 650 notices have been issued in the past three weeks. The team led by DTP (enforcement) Amit Madholia conducted a door-to-door survey in Sectors 55, 56, and 57 to identify properties being misused for commercial use.

news.title: Property rates in Lucknow to surge as new circle rates to come into force from Aug 1
news.para: The new rates, reflecting an average increase of 15% across property types, aim to align with the city's rapid urbanization, enhanced infrastructure, and growing property demand, said additional district magistrate (finance), Rakesh Kumar said.

news.title: Jaipur development body to conduct lottery for three residential schemes on July 2
news.para: "The lottery will be held at the Citizen Service Centre of JDA headquarters. We are going to stream the entire event live on JDA's YouTube channel and Facebook page," said JDA commissioner Anandhi in a press statement.

news.title: Thiruvananthapuram leads state in residential registrations
news.para: From Jan 1 to June 30, state capital recorded a remarkable 1,068 residential units, the highest in the state and the only district to surpass the 1,000-unit milestone.
